entries.meaning: (uncountable) The quality or condition of being instrumental; serving a purpose, being useful.
examples: In a later vision the Saviour revealed to her in detail the ‘great design’ which he wished to establish through her instrumentality.

entries.meaning: (countable, law) A governmental organ with a specific purpose.
examples: Any work in which the copyright was ever owned or administered by the Alien Property Custodian and in which the restored copyright would be owned by a government or instrumentality thereof, is not a restored work.

entries.meaning: (countable) Something that is instrumental; an instrument.
